items.title: Trump authorises ‘full force’ as he orders troops to ‘war-ravaged’ Portland

items.content: Move to protect immigration enforcement facilities is fourth deployment in Democrat-controlled US cities

items.title: Donald Trump says he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon
items.standfirst: Apparently misled by hyperbolic reporting from conservative outlets on a single small protest, president described peaceful city as ‘war ravaged’Donald Trump said on Saturday he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office.Trump made the announcement on social media, using references to antifascists and US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice). He claimed that the deployment was necessary “to protect War ravaged Portland, and any of our ICE Facilities under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Continue reading...
items.content: Apparently misled by hyperbolic reporting from conservative outlets on a single small protest, president described peaceful city as ‘war ravaged’Donald Trump said on Saturday he is deploying troops to Portland, Oregon, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office.Trump made the announcement on social media, using references to antifascists and US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice). He claimed that the deployment was necessary “to protect War ravaged Portland, and any of our ICE Facilities under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump announces deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon to handle ‘domestic terrorists’
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he was authorizing the deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon, which he described as “under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Portland is the latest city targeted by the Trump administration for deployments following announcements regarding Chicago, Memphis, Washington, DC and Los Angeles.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said he was authorizing the deployment of federal troops to Portland, Oregon, which he described as “under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists”. Portland is the latest city targeted by the Trump administration for deployments following announcements regarding Chicago, Memphis, Washington, DC and Los Angeles.

items.title: Trump says he will send troops to Portland to deal with 'domestic terrorists'

items.content: President Trump is authorizing the deployment of troops to "protect" Portland and ICE facilities there from "domestic terrorists" as he expands his controversial deployments to more U.S. cities.(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)

The rally was organized by the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam political party.
Vijay is a well-known actor and politician in southern India.

items.title: Any aggression against Russia will be met with 'decisive response', Lavrov tells UN
items.standfirst: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavron on Saturday told the UN General Assembly that his nation doesn't intend to attack Europe but will mount a “decisive response” to any aggression. FRANCE 24's Aidan Stretch reports from Kyiv, where Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday said Ukraine received a US-made Patriot air defence system from Israel a month ago.

items.title: Sergei Lavrov warns NATO and EU countries over 'aggression' towards Russia

items.content: Vladimir Putin's top diplomat says Russia has no intention of attacking any NATO or EU member state but warned of a "decisive response" if any "aggression" was directed towards Moscow.

items.content: Sergei Lavrov has been highly critical of Western countries and Israel in his speech at the UN General Assembly.

items.title: Lavrov warns of ‘decisive response’ to ‘aggression’ as NATO boosts vigilance after drone incidents
items.standfirst: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov told the UN General Assembly on Saturday that any aggression against his country will be met with a decisive response. His address came as NATO has been considering whether to shoot down Russian aircraft after a series of incursions over several NATO member states.
items.content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov told the UN General Assembly on Saturday that any aggression against his country will be met with a decisive response. items.content: The US has said it will cancel the visa of the President of Colombia after he urged US troops to disobey Donald Trump's orders.

items.title: US revokes visa for Colombian president Gustavo Petro after ‘reckless’ actions in New York
items.standfirst: At a pro-Palestine protest, Petro urged US soldiers to ‘disobey Trump’s order’ and ‘not point their rifles at humanity’The US state department said on Friday it would revoke the visa of Colombian leftist president Gustavo Petro for his “incendiary actions” during a pro-Palestinian street protest in New York.“Earlier today, Colombian president @petrogustavo stood on a NYC street and urged US soldiers to disobey orders and incite violence,” the state department said on X. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

Petro made comments at a pro-Palestinian demonstration in New York.
The Colombian president accused Trump of violating UN principles.

clusters.title: Assata Shakur, black liberation activist exiled in Cuba, dies at 78
clusters.neutral_headline: Assata Shakur, black liberation activist, dies at 78

items.title: Assata Shakur, black liberation activist exiled in Cuba, dies at 78
items.standfirst: She fled to Cuba after being convicted in the killing of a police officer but denied the shooting.
items.content: She fled to Cuba after being convicted in the killing of a police officer but denied the shooting.

items.title: Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
items.standfirst: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...
items.content: Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prisonOn 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to Cuba’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Cuban officials cited the reason for her death as old age and health conditions. Shakur, a longstanding symbol of resistance and Black liberation, spent several decades exiled in Cuba after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison.“At approximately 1:15pm on September 25th, my mother, Assata Shakur, took her last earthly breath,” her daughter Kakuya Shakur wrote on Facebook. “Words cannot describe the depth of loss that I’m feeling at this time.” Continue reading...

items.title: Assata Shakur, Black Liberation Army member convicted of killing a state trooper, dies at 78
items.standfirst: Black liberation activist and American fugitive Assata Shakur, who escaped to Cuba more than 45 years ago after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper, died in Havana, the government announced Friday.
items.content: Black liberation activist and American fugitive Assata Shakur, who escaped to Cuba more than 45 years ago after she was convicted of killing a New Jersey state trooper, died in Havana, the government announced Friday.

ai_summary: Assata Shakur, a Black Liberation Army member, died at age 78.
Shakur was exiled in Cuba after being convicted of killing a police officer.
She spent decades in exile after escaping from prison.
Cuban officials cited old age and health conditions as the cause of death.
Shakur was a symbol of resistance and Black liberation.

items.title: Trader Joe’s and Walmart Frozen Meals May Have Listeria Linked to Outbreak

items.title: Warnings for Trader Joe’s and Walmart meals after 4 killed by listeria contamination
items.standfirst: By JONEL ALECCIA Federal health officials are warning consumers not to eat certain heat-and-eat pasta meals sold at Walmart and Trader Joe’s because they may be contaminated with listeria bacteria linked to a deadly outbreak. The U.S. Agriculture Department updated a public health alert Friday…

The U.S. Agriculture Department updated a public health alert Friday…

items.standfirst: The USDA is warning consumers not to eat certain ready-to-eat pasta meals sold at Walmart and Trader Joe's stores because they may be contaminated with listeria bacteria.
items.content: The USDA is warning consumers not to eat certain ready-to-eat pasta meals sold at Walmart and Trader Joe's stores because they may be contaminated with listeria bacteria.

clusters.title: England overpower Canada to win Women's World Cup

items.standfirst: England produce a performance full of power and ferocity to defeat Canada at Twickenham and win the Women's Rugby World Cup for a third time.
items.content: England produce a performance full of power and ferocity to defeat Canada at Twickenham and win the Women's Rugby World Cup for a third time.

items.title: Watch: Highlights of England's victory
items.standfirst: England have won their third Rugby World Cup title with a commanding 13-33 performance over Canada in front of an 81,885 person home crowd in Twickenham.
items.content: England have won their third Rugby World Cup title with a commanding 13-33 performance over Canada in front of an 81,885 person home crowd in Twickenham.

items.title: England beat Canada to win Women's Rugby World Cup for a third time
items.standfirst: Tournament hosts and favourites England outclassed Canada 33-13 in the Women's Rugby World Cup final on Saturday to clinch the title for a third time on a memorable day for the sport.
items.content: Tournament hosts and favourites England outclassed Canada 33-13 in the Women's Rugby World Cup final on Saturday to clinch the title for a third time on a memorable day for the sport.

ai_summary: England defeated Canada with a score of 33-13 in the Women's Rugby World Cup final.

This victory marks England's third time winning the Women's Rugby World Cup.
England's performance against Canada was described as powerful and dominant.
The final was a memorable day for the sport of women's rugby.

items.title: Harrods Warns Customers of Data Theft in Latest IT Breach
items.standfirst: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.
items.content: Customers of Harrods Ltd., the luxury London department store, had their personal data stolen, the latest in a string of cyberattacks and IT breaches affecting major UK businesses this year.

items.title: Harrods warns customers their data may have been stolen in IT breach
items.standfirst: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...
items.content: Luxury department store says passwords and payment details were not affected in the ‘isolated incident’Harrods has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in an IT breach, after a system belonging to one of its third-party providers was compromised.Information such as names and contact details of its e-commerce customers was taken, the luxury department store in Knightsbridge, London, said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Harrods department store has warned customers about a data theft incident.
The breach involved a system belonging to a third-party provider.
Information such as names and contact details were taken from e-commerce customers.
Passwords and payment details were not affected by the incident.
The breach is the latest in a series of cyberattacks affecting UK businesses.
